meanings.definition: A person who assists a clerk in their duties.
meanings.sent1: The subclerks helped organize the files for the clerk.
meanings.sent2: The office manager assigned the subclerks to answer phone calls.
meanings.sent3: The subclerks accidentally mixed up all the paperwork and caused chaos in the office.
meanings.sent4: The subclerks were the backbone of the office, keeping everything running smoothly.
meanings.sent5: The diligent subclerks diligently completed their tasks ahead of schedule.

meanings.definition: The group of individuals who work under the supervision of a clerk.
meanings.sent1: The subclerks met every morning to discuss their tasks for the day.
meanings.sent2: The clerk relied on the subclerks to handle customer inquiries efficiently.
meanings.sent3: During the office party, the subclerks surprised everyone with their dance moves.
meanings.sent4: The subclerks formed a tight-knit team, supporting each other through busy days.
meanings.sent5: The subclerks' dedication to their work impressed the entire office staff.
